channel.title: Articles on Jay Little
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on Jay Little

item.title: About
item.description:
Who

The content in this site typically has something to do with me, Jay Little. As you may have guessed, I own and run this site. On this site you can find out a lot of things about me by just poking your head about and seeing what pops up. If you have any questions please feel free to email me and I assure you that I will make an attempt to address your concerns.

item.title: Doris Godbee's Chicken and Rice
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 1 1/2 Cups Of Water

  • 3/4 Cup of Uncooked Long Grain Rice

  • 1 Can (10.5 oz) Cream of Chicken Soup

  • 3 Chicken Breasts

  • Black Pepper

  • Salt

  • Paprika

How to Make

  1. Preheat Oven to 375 degrees

  2. Mix Water and Rice in 13" x 9" casserole dish

  3. Add a few dashes of salt to the rice / water mix

  4. Add Cream of Chicken Soup to the mix

  5. Mix cautiously but relatively well using a fork

item.title: Jay and Annette Wedding 2004
item.description:
Introduction

I’ve finally decided to settle down a bit and as a result I’ve gotten married. Who was the lucky (unlucky?) girl you ask? Well it was none other than my long time girlfriend, the love of my life, and truly my soulmate: Annette Louise Prescott. I know that I haven’t spoken about Annette very much on the site so here is a little bit of the backstory for those of you who don’t already know:

item.title: Jays Award Winning Mac and Cheese
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 1 cup uncooked rotini pasta (it holds cheese better - don’t lie, you wish you had thought of it now)

  • 2 tablespoons salted butter (we are all gonna die, may as well enjoy it)

  • 1 1/2 cups hand grated mix of Parmesan, Asiago and Gouda cheese (yes I really mean hand grated from three premium blocks of cheese - dont buy that crap pre-grated nonsense either)

  • 1 cup grated sharp cheddar cheese (from the store or whatever, we used a three cheddar variant mix with a larger grate)

item.title: Meme's Decadent Peanut Butter Pie
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 8 ounces of Cream Cheese

  • 1 cup of Peanut Butter

    Creamy, not that Chunky Garbage

  • 16 ounces of Cool Whip

  • 1 1/2 cups of Powdered Sugar

  • Pre-made Graham Cracker or Oreo Pie Crust

How to Make

  1. Soften Cream Cheese (leave it in room temperature for a bit).

    This makes it easier to complete the following step

  2. Mix Cream Cheese, Peanut Butter and Cool Whip until fluffy

    Pro Tip: Do it with a real Kitchen-Aid mixer, anything else is just you lying to yourself

item.title: Meme's Sausage Balls
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 1 pound of Sausage

  • 3 1/2 cups of Bisquick

  • 10 ounces of shredded cheese

How to Make

  1. Combine all ingredients with your hands and shape loosely into small balls

    May be frozen on cookie sheet before baking

    This step appears easy. It is not. It will hurt your hands and make you want to quit. Don’t. This recipe is worth the effort you will put into it.

  2. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes

item.title: Pa Little's Christmas Fudge
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 4 cups sugar

  • 1 can (13 oz) evaporated milk

  • 2 sticks marg. or butter (1 cup or 1/2 lb)

  • 1 tb vanilla extract

  • 2 cups miniature marshmallows

  • 2 cups nuts (optional)

    YMMV: I recommend against exercising this option

  • 3 cups (18 oz) chocolate chips

How to Make

  1. Mix sugar, evaporated milk, butter and vanilla extract

  2. Bring the mixture to a boil

  3. Boil for 11 minutes, stirring constantly

    Seriously if it burns or doesn’t boil, the fudge will suck

item.title: Pa Little's Tuna Casserole
item.description:
Ingredients List

  • 3 Cups Uncooked Elbow Macaroni

  • 1 Can (6 oz) Tuna

  • 1 Can (10.5 oz) Cream of Mushroom Soup

  • 1 Soup Can of Milk

    Non-Dairy milks such as Almond, Oat or Soy also work and we prefer them

  • 6 oz Bag Potato Chips Crushed

  • Black Pepper

How to Make

  1. Boil a bowl/pot of water

  2. Add uncooked macaroni to boiling water

  3. Boil for 8 minutes until done

  4. Drain macaroni

  5. Mix Mushroom soup, 1 soup can of milk, and drained tuna in a casserole dish

item.title: Recipes
item.description:
Why?

The purpose of this article is to document various recipes that have been floating around in my family and Annette’s family for years now. Some of these were handwritten, some of them were typed up in a more formal fashion, but all of them were essentially kept within the family. Until now.

Annette and I have seen a lot of family members pass over the last few years and making some of their recipes has helped to keep the memory of these departed family members alive so to speak. So with that in mind, I took it upon myself to start documenting various recipes and publishing them on my website.
